scenario: Duke Energy Corporation DUK shares are trading higher premarket after reporting first-quarter adjusted EPS of $1.76, beating the consensus of $1.60. Revenues of $8.25 billion exceeded the consensus of $8.06 billion. Electric Utilities and Infrastructure segment income increased to $1.28 billion, led by higher retail sales volumes, better weather and new rates. Gas Utilities and Infrastructure segment income was $349 million, up from $284 million a year ago. Operating cash flow was $2.2 billion and cash and equivalents were $475 million. The company reaffirmed its FY25 Outlook with adjusted EPS of $6.17-$6.42, below the consensus of $6.32. The long-term adjusted EPS growth rate remains 5-7% through 2029. DUK shares are up 0.83% at $121.75 premarket.
